Why are we collecting chromebooks for grades 6-8 students when we have not collected them in the past couple of years?

This is because students are usually getting their device checked in collaboration with their teacher. This health check is usually done during the last week of school. Due to our current situation, we need to collect the devices, assess them and do a health check to ensure they are in the best working condition for the start of the school year. Further information about insurance and deployment of devices will be forthcoming.

Congratulations to Nora Shanks and Charles Brydges for being named the male and female scholar athletes for the Class of 2020. Nora and Charles are both multi-sport athletes that represent SHS in the highest level when it comes to sportsmanship, competitiveness and school spirit.

When asked to say a few words about Charles, Coach Casolari commented, "I have worked with Charles both in the classroom, and on the athletic field and he is an exceptional leader in both areas. Most impressive to me is his solid character, and willingness to work with others."

When asked to say a few words about Nora, Coach Casinghino offered, "Nora's leadership, intrinsic motivation and positivity shine through on the field hockey field. She is the student athlete that every coach wants on their team."

Congratulations again to Charles and Nora on their well earned recognition.

‚ÄúPop! The Invention of Bubblegum‚Äù by Meghan McArthy is the interesting story of how the gum ‚ÄòDouble Bubble‚Äô was invented. An accountant named Walter Diemer became curious about a laboratory next to his office. The company was trying to make a new kind of chewing gum. Walter started to experiment and ultimately created the very first bubblegum. Even though he hit some roadblocks along the way, he persevered and ultimately accomplished his goal of making children happy. This book is a great introductory read for introducing Hopes and Dreams, a component of Responsive Classroom and the importance of persevering to accomplish our goals.
